page.title: 10Severn Valley Railway.
page.content: A valuable new tourist attraction for Kidderminster is undoubtedly the recently re-opened Severn Valley Railway line linking the British Rail Station at Kidderminster with Bewdley and Bridgnorth. The Bewdley-Bridgnorth line was opened in 1974. This railway, run mainly by about 400 volunteers, operates a regular steam-hauled passenger train service between Kidderminster and Bridgnorth. Tourists and enthusiasts are attracted from all over the world. The railway has frequently been the setting for films, notably "The Thirty-Nine Steps" and the BBC TV series "God's Wonderful Railway". For children, one of the chief delights is the Santa Special (see page 11).
